abstract.text: Saves document data to the specified location in the application sandbox.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The file URL identifying the location in the application sandbox to write the document data to. Typically, this is the URL obtained from the
property.
A constant that indicates whether the document file is being written the first time or whether it is being overwritten. See
for details.
A block with code that is executed when the save operation concludes. The block returns no value and has one parameter:
if the save operation succeeds, otherwise
This block is invoked on the calling queue.
The default implementation of this method first calls the
method synchronously on the calling queue to get the document data to save. Then it calls the
method on a background queue to perform the actual writing of the data to disk.
If you override this method, it’s recommended that you first call the superclass implementation of the method (
). If you do not call
, you must do two things:
Call
to put the save operation on a background queue.
In the block parameter, implement coordinated writing by using the
class.
From within the coordinated write, call

abstract.text: An object that coordinates the reading and writing of files and directories among file presenters.
A false value.
A true value.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An abstract base class for managing discrete portions of your app’s data.
Constants that specify the type of save operation.
Asynchronously closes the document after saving any changes.
Returns the document data to be saved.
Returns a dictionary of file attributes to associate with the document file when writing or updating it.
Returns a file extension to append to the file URL of the document file being written.
The file URL you use to initialize the document.
Schedules a document-reading or document-writing operation on a concurrent background queue.
Saves document data to the specified location in the application sandbox.
Returns the file type to use for saving a document.
Ensures that document data is written safely to a specified location in the application sandbox.
Writes the document data to disk at the sandbox location indicated by a file URL.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
An object representing the location of a resource that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.

value.text: An object that represents the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
